data.title: Economic diversity and student outcomes at Ohio Northern
data.meta_description: See how Ohio Northern compares to more than 2,000 American colleges.
data.text:
The median family income of a student from Ohio Northern is $100,200, and 41% come from the top 20 percent. About 1.6% of students at Ohio Northern came from a poor family but became a rich adult.

A new study, based on millions of anonymous tax records, shows that some colleges are even more economically segregated than previously understood, while others are associated with income mobility.

Below, estimates of how Ohio Northern compares with its peer schools in economic diversity and student outcomes.
